title: At which moment do you feel the most sorrow in the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let me tell you a story of my friend, Mike. When Mike was in elementary school he would complain that his mom didn’t buy him his video game. He complained, complained, and complained. When Mike was in middle school he was worried about not being the most popular kid and that Jordan was much more of an athletic stud than he was. Mike always wanted to be the strongest in his class. When Mike was in high school he was mad that his volleyball team didn’t make the state finals. He felt sorrow when his main group of friends from middle school stopped talking to him. He was confused when Chelsea stopped talking to him out of the blue (fuck chelsea btw). When Mike was in college he decided it wasn’t for him, so he dropped out of college. He went to pursue his dream of becoming a professional basketball player and when he realized he was not up to par with the elites, he gave up. When Mike was old his heart was giving out. It was then that he realized that complaining to his mom did nothing, that being the strongest out of a bunch of middle school kids is meaningless, that Chelsea is a piece of shit, and that his dream of becoming a basketball player was only 1 of his many dreams. Most importantly, Mike realize that all of his sorrows of the past were temporary. They came and then they left. The biggest sorrow of Mike’s life was not realizing that sorrow came from within. Mike made his sorrow and when it was time, he decided to get rid of it.

There are all kinds of sorrow, and all kinds of occasions for sorrow. I have experienced many of them, from the deeply personal to the global. But if you want to know the single most painful pang of sorrow for me, the answer may surprise you. It was the moment when I knew that it was time to do the right thing and give my lovely, sweet, beautiful kitten Ariel a merciful death. Why was this so painful, given the incredible range of things there are to bewail in this world? 1. My kitten was purely innocent. Her illness was incurable and she was suffering. She certainly did not, nor could not, have done anything to "deserve" such a fate. 2. She could not understand what was happening or what was coming. There was nothing I could do to comfort her.  3. The responsibility for her death was mine and mine alone. 4. We had a true bond of love. I knew I was going to miss her and mourn her for the rest of my life. 5. She trusted me completely. And that meant I had to do right by her even though it was incredibly painful to me.  Love is the source of the deepest sorrow.And it is entirely worth it.

Thank you for the A2A Hima Ghiri Amidst all the chaos and the hullabaloo revolving around the deadly covid-19, and the recent announcement of 21 days National lockdown. I happened to stumble upon a video shared by one of the news channels on their social media handle. A rickshaw-puller along with two of his kids was roaming the empty streets of Delhi, in the hope of finding, at least a single traveler so that he can buy food for his starving kids. “The children haven't eaten for 2–3 days, and there's not a single grain of rice at home. Ever since the harmful virus has affected our country. People have stopped coming out of their houses. How are we supposed to survive if we don't get passengers? After the announcement of the lockdown, the price of basic necessities has shot higher. Look at us, we can't afford a morsel of a meal for the kids, leave alone dreaming of buying at double-triple rates.” Trust me, I kept my phone aside and cried my heart out for some time. There was this feeling of uneasiness and sorrow churning deep in my gut. The helplessness in the father’s eyes and those hunger-stricken innocent eyes kept flashing in front of my vision. I do not know, what the implications of covid will be. How far we will be able to come out a warrior, though each one of us is trying in their best spirit. But the daily wagers and the below poverty line are left with only two options: ‘Die of hunger (with the lockdown)’‘Die of covid (if on the road without the lockdown)’When we are safely locked up in the warmth of our homes. We should also think about these people and urge those in power to not let them die out of their misfortune.  Image courtesy: http://getty images

I researched alot but can't find direct answer . So, in my perspective and experience biggest sorrow is… Seeing someone DYING The one whom you love alot and they loved you back in the same way and even more than you and you can't do anything because it's not in your hand . No matter how greatest doctor you are, no matter how rich you are , now matter how many good powerful connections you have . You don't able to anything your money , pride , education seem worthless and meaningless . You see them in pain , you gonna shaked entirely but you can't able to do anything accept see them in pain and show them sympathy or give them some hope . But you know right . Seeing our parents getting old . . Our lovely parents how easily they said all the time “you are my child you may grown up by age but you still our small baby.. innocent ,cute , doesn't know about worldy wolf .” I don't know why but our parents forget..” No matter how much time pass and they become more and more old we never accept that they getting old they still our young , strong and superhero for us “. Why they forget when we got our brain, since that time to still we see them as usual . Why and how they got wrinkles , their body pain which gone regular now , loosing working capacity or complains about weakness . Dear, parents we relate these things to us like we got pain due tough and hectic day in some occasiona . We thought that your wrinkles is nothing that things there because you may didn't take your nap properly , you gonna weak because you don't take your meal properly like us . We don't relate these things to your age . This is psychological ,okay . We don't accept that you gonna old as we become mature . Loosing your internal energy .. Go and search for motivation .. you found hundreds of videos and thousands of articles and books on this topic . Everyone has a story . How they are idiot once in a life and sudden become an UPSC topper , Bank manager , CA ,CM, Army etc .. How they deal with stress , depression and anxiety when they failed and how they just move on. You know what common thing you found in all these stories,articles and videos sharing ?You found they have dream . They have passion which never let them sleep whole night , which never let them live satisfied in what they have . No matter much they are poor ,rich or financial crisis crushed them they their dream , passion never let them to accept that condition . They have burning sensesation in their body which make them crazy to do anything and fought any battle . That passion,dream and that burning fire make them conquer of the world . But what if someone don't have these type of burning fire inside them . Those who never knew on which path they want to go and meet heart comfort . These type of people may have all talent but they don't know what's their aim and heart soothing palace is . They have no passion , no dream and burning fire take and they lived meaningless life . They just breathe . Remember Hrithik Roushan movie “ Lakshya” . This movie based on that . Go and watch if you don't watch yet ! Loosing yourself .. I’m very filmy . So , Do you watch a bollywood movie named “ Tamasha” Ranbir and Deepika's movie ? If you watch that movie you can realised what happened if someone only dream die . The boy who is cool , laugh , talking and enjoying and playing in their life . He shown very lively . But life took a sudden turn and everything changed . His only dream die . He loose his self completely . He may had a job , a settled life but within him he was dead . He loose himself completely . Nothing make him happily . Or , sometime watch try this movie “ Henry searched for his Happiness” . In that movie Henry lived a very awesome life . He was a psychiatrist and he had a very beautiful and supportive wife . Everything seem perfect . No financial crisis , no dream dying but there is something still missing in his life . He daily goes to his clinic listen , his patient suggest him medication and come back home on time . He lived great life but he was not happy . He get bored in his life now he did't feel any happiness . At last his patience broke up he told his wife and just run away from his daily boring life . He was on mission . Mission is “searching for happiness “. He went many countries , experience many things . And at last he found where is happiness . You may thought suddenly why I'm talking about movie . This is because only movie shows you real emotion and you can live all those emotions without having real onces in your life. So, this all may seem simple but believe me this situation gives intolerable sorrow and pain .

That would be my own incompetence at a lot of things that I try to do. I may do okay on most things, but I have never been content with being just “Okay!”. Irony of my life ? I despise being mediocre, and yet, I am as average as average gets. I know, I know. Success takes time and a shit load of hard work. And maybe then if you are a tad bit lucky, you may become exceptional at something. 22 and a half years on this blue planet, and I am yet to win at something. I have competed in lots of events, and lost so many times that I now have stopped keeping a count. Its only in the last few years, as I grew older and wiser, I learned a lot about myself and the reason for my failures. You see, I am what you call, “A poor finisher”. It sucks ! I start with a lot of enthusiasm. I just lose all of my focus and will towards the end. Has happened a lot with me, and I intend to change this attitude ASAP. What’s my greatest sorrow you ask ? That would be knowing all of my limitations and yet being unable to move past them.  Suggestions and edits are welcome. :) Sources - Wordgasm (@wordgasminsta) • Instagram photos and videos

According to me not recognizing the value of the few people who actually love us is the biggest sorrow. Because life is very small to hate one another and fight. Why not spend this small life being happy and loving. Slowly everybody goes, why not give them all the possible love in that small span of life. I am recognizing it , I am in the process. Know who really matters and who never did. Because you will not get a second chance everytime. I really regret that for a period of time I damn it didnot value my dear and near ones. I am rectyfing my mistakes. Thank God I realized it before it's too late. I even now know why it happened. We often take for granted the few people who always sacrifice for us. We take them for granted cause we know they won't leave us no matter what. But let's take a moment , realize their value and fall in love with those few people who always loved us, helped us in hard times, beared us when all others left. Thanks…

I personally feel sorrow            when I think about what good things I could do and I did not. and           when I think about what I did and I should not have done (major mistakes).           when I think about when I broke somebody's heart,           when I think about losing my dear ones in the future.......As you see these are just thoughts. Sorrow comes with thoughts. So I try to overcome the negative aspects of these thoughts, and instead of being filled with negative feeling, I try to take lessons from these experiences and improve my personality. After all, life is about experiencing and learning from failures.

Life is sometimes unfair. You have your highs and lows. You have good and bad days. You also have failures. These failures, the thought of my failure puts me in deep sorrow. Especially those failures over which I didn't have control. Not me but my destiny controlled it. Sometimes, somethings are just not in your hand. You are helpless. This state of helplessness gives me sorrow. The fact that I can't control it or there's nothing I can do about it leaves me in pain and a sorrowful state.

Mental health professionals taking care of everyone but not their own students, scholars or colleagues in the same. We give all the wisdom and knowledge to our patients, how to deal with the adverse situations but when our own people look for it, we become so dismissive. We don't behave with same empthay and unconditional positive regards. This puts me in deep sorrow and pain.

The Nazi holocaust of millions innocent Jews is the saddest period of time to me. It showed us that even in modern times how evil and hateful an ideology can become if left unchecked. The Holocaust was before I was born though.  The saddest moment for me was when the world Trade Center towers were attacked and the loss of life that resulted from it that still continues to this day. Also the first two times a nuclear bomb was used is very saddening to me.

There have been many of these moments in my life. Today I feel great sorrow when others are injured or killed, including humans and animals. Child abuse is unconscionable. Three early moments of sorrow were when President Kennedy, his brother Bobby, and the Rev. Dr Martin Luther King, Jr were assassinated. The fourth moment, and the worst,  happened when I fully realized that my youngest child has schizophrenia.The fifth moment was when the World Trade Center was blown up.

Not being able to see the happier side of life and focusing only on the sorrows of life is the biggest sorrow of life. Nothing is permanent in this creation. Everything that is created gets vanished over the time. Neither our sorrows are permanent. Focusing our energy on something that leaves us depressed by overshadowing the best side of life is the real sorrow of life.

My father passed away in March 2013, then in November that same year my mother in law passed away. Fast forward the next year in October, my father in law passed away. Both my parents in law were in their late 80's but the timing of it was just too overwhelming. Needless to say, 2013 and 2014 were very sorrowful years for our family. Now, I only have my mum left.

Sorrow is always there, people constantly struggle with difficult circumstances, there are wars, death, disease. Sorrow fills the world. Fortunately there is also Joy, Love, Peace and many good things in the world. We can chose where to look - toward sorrow or toward joy. It's good to remember that sorrow exists and do what we can to decrease it, but it's important to look toward joy and replenish ourselves.
